text:
{t:500 Miles / Surrender}
{st:MxPx}
{key: D}

Verse 1:

When I [D]wake up, yeah you [D]know I'm gonna be,
I'm gonna [G]be the man who [A]wakes up next [D]you
And when I [D]go out, yeah you [D]know I'm gonna be
I'm gonna [G]be the man who [A]goes along with [D]you
And If I [D]get drunk, yeah you [D]know I'm gonna be
I'm gonna [G]be the man who's [A]gettin drunk with [D]you
And if I [D]haver, yeah you [D]know I'm gonna be
I'm gonna [G]be the man who's [A]havering to [D]you


Chorus:
[D]I would walk five [D]hundred miles
And [G]I would walk five [A]hundred more
To [D]be the man who [D]walked a thousand [G]miles to fall down [A]at your door

Verse 2:
When I'm [D]workin, yeah you [D]know I'm gonna be
I'm gonna [G]be the man who's [A]working hard for [D]you
And when the [D]money, comes in [D]for the work I do
I'll pass [G]almost every [A]penny on to [D]you
And when I come home [D][D][D],          yeah you know I'm [D][D] [D]gonna be
I'm gonna [G]be the man who's [A]comin home to you [D][D][D]
And when I grow old[D][D][D]           yeah you know I'm [D][D][D]gonna be
I'm gonna [G]be the man who's [A]growing old with [D]you-ou-ou-ou-ou-ou

Chorus:
(2/4 punk drums)
[D]I would walk five [D]hundred miles
And [G]I would walk five [A]hundred more
To [D]be the man who [D]walked a thousand [G]miles to fall down [A]at your door

Post-chorus:
(regular drums)
Da [D]da da (Da da da), Da [D]da da (Da da da)
Da da [G]dum da da dum da da [A]dum da da da da [D]da
Da [D]da da (Da da da), Da [D]da da (Da da da)
Da da [G]dum da da dum da da [A]dum da da da da [D]da

Verse 3:
When I'm [D]dreaming, yeah you [D]know I'm gonna dream
I'm gonna [G]dream about the [A]times when I'm with [D]you
And when I'm [D]lonely, yeah you [D]know I'm gonna be
I'm gonna [G]be the man who's [A]lonely without [Bm (slowly)]you
I'm gonna [G (slowly)]be the man          who's [A (slowly)]comin home     to [(p.m.)]you[D][D][D][D]

Chorus:
[D]I would walk five [D]hundred miles
And [G]I would walk five [A]hundred more
To [D]be the man who [D]walked a thousand [G]miles to fall down [A]at your door

Post-chorus:
(2/4 punk drums)
Da [D]da da (Da da da), Da [D]da da (Da da da)
Da da [G]dum da da dum da da [A]dum da da da da [D]da
Da [D]da da (Da da da), Da [D]da da (Da da da)
Da da [G]dum da da dum da da [A]dum da da da da [D]da

Verse 4:
[D]Mommy's all right, [Bm]Daddy's all right, they [A]just seem a little [G]weird
Surr[D]ender, surr[Bm]ender, but [A]don't give yourself a[G]way
[D]Mommy's all right, [Bm]Daddy's all right, they [A]just seem a little [G]weird
Surr[D]ender, surr[Bm]ender, but [A]don't give yourself a[G]way,  [G]way,  a[G]way-yay
A[D]way-[G]yay-[D]yay-[(p.m.)]yay[A][A][A][A]

Chorus:
(2/4 punk drums)
[D]I would walk five [D]hundred miles
And [G]I would walk five [A]hundred more
To [D]be the man who [D]walked a thousand [G]miles to fall down [A]at your door

Post-chorus:
(regular drums)
Da [D]da da (Da da da), Da [D]da da (Da da da)
Da da [G]dum da da dum da da [A]dum da da da da [D]da
Da [D]da da (Da da da), Da [D]da da (Da da da)
Da da [G (slowing)]dum da da da   da   [A]da      da [D]da
